snippet: Militant forces that once controlled major towns appear to have taken refuge in smaller villages nearby.
abstract: Militant forces that once controlled major towns in Mali appear to have taken refuge in smaller villages nearby,  essentially pulling back to less-contested ground after French-led intervention to oust them.

byline.original: By PETER TINTI and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Peter Tinti reported from Gao, and Adam Nossiter from Dakar, Senegal.

lead_paragraph: Militant forces that once controlled major towns appear to have taken refuge in smaller villages nearby.

headline.seo: Militants Infiltrate Towns in Freed Areas of Mali
headline.main: In Mali, the Peril of Guerrilla War Looms
headline.print_headline: Militants Infiltrate Towns in Freed Areas of Mali, Raising Peril of Guerrilla War
